tasks.title: Canonical Socket Event Registry
deliverables: Full inventory of existing events by namespace (chat, presence, webrtc, media, search).
Classification by domain: messaging, moderation, collaboration, social, notification, planner.
Deprecation map for legacy/non-standard event naming.
acceptance_criteria: Registry references exact payload schemas and response contracts.
No new event can ship without registry entry.

tasks.title: Versioned Schema Strategy
deliverables: Schema versioning convention for socket payloads and kafka envelopes.
Backward compatibility rules and translation handlers for vN to vN+1 transitions.
Validation layer integration points for socket-service and kafka-service.
acceptance_criteria: Breaking event changes require explicit version bump and migration notes.
Consumer services can parse both active and previous schema versions during rollout.

tasks.title: Access Control Matrix Per Event
deliverables: Role/permission matrix for each event type including tenant_admin, member, moderator, viewer.
Cross-tenant and cross-project denial rules for event execution.
Rate-limit profile mapping by event sensitivity and abuse risk.
acceptance_criteria: Security checks are explicit and testable for every event.
Unauthorized event attempts yield stable, observable error codes.

tasks.title: Event Ownership, RFC Workflow, And Automated Changeloging
deliverables: Owner assignment matrix per event namespace and event family with escalation contacts.
RFC/change-request template for new events, breaking schema changes, and deprecations.
Automated changelog generation from registry deltas with migration notes for consumers.
Governance rule that links each event definition to test cases and rollout flags.
acceptance_criteria: Every active event has an explicit technical owner and lifecycle status.
Breaking event changes are blocked unless RFC and migration notes are approved.
Registry deltas automatically produce consumer-facing change documentation.
